title: Rapidfire Cannon and Stakkik Shiv have a unique feature.
body:
Compared to other items which share similar effects, they're the only two items that work in tandem with each other rather than overwrite the other.

As examples:

* {{item:1402}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3025}} Do NOT all stack, as the spellblade effect is unique. **(EDIT: People have corrected me in saying that while the damage doesn't stack, the AoE effects do)**
* {{item:3074}} {{item:3748}} Do NOT stack, but you're free to swap between the two.
* {{item:3068}} {{item:1401}} Do NOT stack, even though the damage effect is different between champions and monsters.
* {{item:3004}} {{item:3003}} Technically stack but you have to finish one tear before the other can begin stacking.
* {{item:3060}} {{item:3190}} Do NOT stack unless on different champions.
* {{item:3056}} {{item:3512}} Do NOT stack
* {{item:3094}} {{item:3087}} DO stack, get the full effect form both and both charge under one energize effect. (It won't charge faster but it'll combine the two charges)

I know the list of champions who can use both is likely limited to, say, Vayne and Tristana but it's frustrating that these items don't have consistency. Can we make the energized effect unique so you have to decide between having long-range poke or wave-clear. If anything else, I'd just do it for the sake of consistence.

Well

We COULD make it so that all the other effects aren't unique...

That is true. But with {{item:3094}} & {{item:3087}} both of them get the bonus magic damage bonus without overwriting each other at all. I think that is what CaptainMårvelous is trying to say I think.

If we wanted to be consistent with how the others are managed, we'd probably have to make the two stacks synchronous, and have the empowered auto be both longer range and static, but only dealing 100 (and not 200) bonus damage.
However, I'm not certain how much syncing them up would actually side-effect buff, and if the reliability would make up for the damage loss.

> {{item:1402}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3025}} Do NOT all stack, as the spellblade effect is unique.

***WRONG***

This is probably the biggest misconception in League of Legends. They do in fact stack, and there are specific rules for how they do so.

* In terms of damage applied, they have this priority: {{item:3100}} >{{item:1402}} >{{item:3078}} >{{item:3025}} >{{item:3057}} 
* In terms of secondary effect, {{item:3025}}'s and {{item:1402}}'s AoEs and extra effects (slow for IBG, mana restore for Runeglaive) stack completely with any and all other spell blade effects.

In fact, this set of interactions behaves ***IDENTICALLY*** to the way the effects of Statikk Shiv and RFC stack. They share the same named passive, but since the bonus effects do different things, they apply together. Statikk Shiv and RFC actually function exactly as they should.

{{item:3074}} and {{item:3748}} don't stack because they serve the same exact function (on-hit melee AoE waveclear) and are interchangeable.

{{item:3068}} and {{item:1413}} don't stack because they are virtually identical on top of sharing a named passive, the stronger effect takes priority, just like with Spellblade's unique damage modifier.

{{item:3003}} and {{item:3004}} stack 100%, but the Tear of the goddess passive doesn't stack for the sake of balance (otherwise you could technically stack 6 tears at once, which would be broken as hell on a certain purple mage...)

{{item:3105}}/{{item:3060}}/{{item:3190}} do not stack because they are literally identical passives. This is the same as with a Zhonya's active being unique, not in any way like RFC/Shiv or the Spellblade passives.

{{item:2053}}/{{item:3512}}/{{item:3056}} same as with Locket and co.

**TL;DR: RFC and Shiv work as intended, you are actually just comparing apples and oranges with the other item passives.**

As far as I'm aware, the {{item:3748}}/{{item:3074}} interaction is because they are interchangeable and probably has something to do with that aspect of their design, because you're right, one would think that the two passives should work that way. This one seems to be the least consistent passive interaction of everything you've mentioned.

In regards to {{item:3068}}/{{item:1413}}, I'm pretty sure that actually is already the case. I may be totally wrong, but that *should* be how those two interact.

When you have both {{item:3004}} and {{item:3003}}, they actually *do* function that way. There is still the same static cooldown between stacks which is shared between both items as well as tear (2 charges every 8 seconds), but auto attacks proc the manamune version of the stack (+4 mana on attack or ability use) and Archangels procs for abilities (+8 mana on ability use). Again, you can only stack one tear at a time (so only 2 charges every 8 seconds, instead of potentially 12 charges every 8 seconds if you built 6 tear items), but the enhanced stacking mechanic means you stack each individual tear slightly faster than normal. Ironically enough, you can see this function in action during the "Ultimate Bravery" Showmatch between EU and Asia from a few days ago in the wildcard tournament. The Riven was given the black card build and had to go {{item:3158}}>{{item:3003}}>{{item:3004}}>into several other weird items. While he had both items built, you could actually watch each of them proccing individually for separate things (manamune proccing off of AAs, Archangel's proccing off of ability casts).
